website_summaries.verdict: If you long for a state-of-the-art toaster but don't have extra cash or counter space to spare, this 2-slice offering from Cuisinart strikes the best balance between modern features and dependable functionality.
pros: Ultra-sleek, modern design blends well with just about any kitchen décor
Features a stylish blue backlit LCD countdown display and backlit Toast, Defrost, Bagel, and Cancel buttons
Compact 2-slice capacity has a small footprint
cons: More modern than most, but it's not leverless

customer_reviews.title: one annoying design flaw keeps me from giving it more stars
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to do. While it toasts ok, one annoying design flaw keeps me from giving it more stars. Upon tilting it upside down to clear out excess crumbs, some of the crumbs got inside the display. Cuisinart offered to send another, but it wasn't worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Teajay_dc

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: The plastic handle fell off a couple of months ago and I am unable to put it back on securely. It appears to be a very flimsy design. I emailed Cuisinart with a copy of the invoice (twice-12/27 and 1/19) showing it is clearly within the warranty period but have yet to receive a response. Pretty poor customer service. I am not certain I would buy another Cuisinart small appliance.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: What’s that sound? Why is the toaster making noise?
customer_reviews.text: This toaster caused an hour long what’s that sound hunt in our house one evening. It turns out the digital display makes a constant hum noise. After being plugged in for two days, it started making this electrical humming sound. After finally figuring out what it was we contacted the manufacturer, who told us that that was normal and that these toasters do make that noise all the time. So if you’re not fond a slightly loud electrical humming noise constantly going on in the background of your home, don’t buy this toaster!
customer_reviews.author: JAMES P LAPOINTE

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment! I chose Cuisinart because my cheap 2-slice version works fine. This was a gift for my daughter's family, but I use it a few times a week When I watch grandkids. I can put two slices of bread in the same side on number three and one comes out white and one comes out almost burnt. Also one day number three is perfect for toast and the next daY it's way too dark! Thank goodness for Amazon's return policy!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Reader

customer_reviews.title: I was not sure this would be a good buy after reading some of the reviews
customer_reviews.text: It's growing on me. I was not sure this would be a good buy after reading some of the reviews. The first time I used it it had a weird smell, but that went away very quickly. The first 5 or 6 times the toast didn't toast all that well, but now it is fine. It took a while to "work itself in". I like the bell alarm to let you know when the toast is done, It isn't that loud and the alarm doesn't last that long. I would recommend it and like it now.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Lyndy

customer_reviews.title: OK, but should be better at toasting evenly.
customer_reviews.text: Chosen to replace 40 year old toaster that finally died. Selected for its relatively small footprint. Brushed stainless finish matches well with other appliances we own. The extra lift mechanism for small items is a nice feature because we use loaf bread that is smaller than standard size. Settings are easy to figure out. Cord wrap/hide feature is a bit tricky but once done its OK. Some disappointment with toasting evenly. Top third of loaf bead on the "3" setting is very light while the bottom part of the bread is about right.
customer_reviews.author: Swamp Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: High frequency buzz
customer_reviews.text: Bought one, returned defective after hearing loud high frequency buzz as soon as plugged in (likely from LCD display) and strong electronics burning smell when testing functionality. Replacement arrived with same high frequency buzz, didn't even bother testing the electronics burning smell as the last stink took over an hour to clear out of the house. Unfortunate as this model had every feature I was interested in and was highly rated by Consumer Reports.
customer_reviews.author: Brian F

customer_reviews.title: Hot to touch
customer_reviews.text: When using the pop up feature, there is nothing to hold onto when pushing the lever up. The surface is hot all over, and I have to use a mitt to hold onto the toaster while pulling the lever up to pop up and grab an english muffin. Very attractive though. My previous Cuisinart toaster had a plastic base to hold onto (hint hint for a future model)
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Not Pleased at all
customer_reviews.text: Just received toaster, as other reviews said on one side of the toast it is nice and brown on the other side barely toasted. I bought this to replace a $13.00 toaster I bought 10 years ago that still worked perfectly. I'm sending this $45.00 toaster back ASAP
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS E MYERS

customer_reviews.title: Works great, nice-looking toaster
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster. It looks good and it works great. I will pass on something that I did. At first I tried to change the light dark setting and it would only show 4. I was ready to pack it back up when I realized it had a plastic sticker over it to show you what the display would look like. I peeled it off. How stupid did I feel? But I'm thinking I might not be the only one so I thought I'd pass it on.
customer_reviews.author: M Mc

customer_reviews.title: Works great... for a while
customer_reviews.text: This toaster has some nice features - love the defrost option and the countdown timer - but in the past 2 years that we’ve had it, we’ve had to gradually increase the settings to achieve the same level of... toastiness. What you used to get at the 3 setting now requires setting the toaster to 5. God help you if you’re trying to toast a frozen waffle, because it’s equally likely to come out still cold or almost burnt. The toaster still works (i.e. stuff gets toasted), but for this much money I would expect it to work consistently.
customer_reviews.author: rachaeld

customer_reviews.title: Nice toaster! Works well and looks good!
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving my new toaster. The stainless steel all around looks very nice in my kitchen. I've been using it now for a little while and I haven't noticed the wizzing sound others commented on. I also didn't find the toaster to be that hot to the touch like others mentioned. However, as with any stainless steel product, it will get hot when near heat. So I guess every owner is different...just keep that possibility in mind if you're considering buying a stainless steel toaster. Bread came out nicely toasted as expected. Bagels took me a while to find the right setting but once I did I loved the result. In all, I love the toaster. Happy purchase here!! 😊
customer_reviews.author: Gordo

customer_reviews.title: All of these make buzzing noise
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a nice compact toaster with good features. Aside from the fact that stainless steel is a fingerprint magnet that will be impossible to keep clean, this model makes a high-pitched buzzing noise. I had two, one was better than another, but they all make noise when just sitting there. The noise is more noticeable when the display blue backlight turns off (after a couple of minutes not using). It's too bad because it's a nice looking toaster. If you are having a difficult time finding a toaster, we went with Calphalon 2084021 - no issues so far and we are keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Loy

customer_reviews.title: Can't read the toasting number
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty nice toaster, but one side burns and the other side is fine, although set on the same number . The chosen numbers are displayed on a blue-light screen- very modern, but you can't read them! The number 4 doesn't appear to ever change, so it's a crap shoot as to what you're toast will look like. When you press up or down you need to remember what number you chose! The slots could be wider, especially with today's breads and bagels, etc.
customer_reviews.author: christine wood

customer_reviews.title: Two useless toasters and terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Received toaster in April, and by August it was burning everything regardless of what setting it was on. September 2nd I contacted Cuisinart, and wasn't able to get a hold of a person until October 3rd. They sent a replacement toaster since it was still under warranty. After three weeks the replacement toaster stopped toasting. Trying to get the problem resolved was a hassle to begin with. Going back to customer service a second time would be too much work. Needless to say, I'm buying another toaster...and it will definitely NOT be a Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Longtime Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, though substandard, toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is a really pretty toaster: brushed stainless steel with a blue, backlit display, but the damn thing only goes up to SEVEN and, even at that level, doesn't get the toast very dark. It shouldn't take multiple toastings to achieve a modicum of brownness on an English muffin or bagel. Also, this thing is pretty damn expensive for a pop-up toaster. It replaces an old Cuisinart that wouldn't stay in the "down" position. Unless I'm doing something wrong, I don't know why the default toasting darkness is set so low. I'll work with it for the time being, but I have found that Cuisinart products are pretty much trash.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good toast, annoying noise
customer_reviews.text: This toaster toasts well. It seems to be evenly toasting our bread and bagels alike. We typically use it on 4 for a lightly toasted piece of toast. I like it cranked to 7 for my more stubborn gluten free bread. My o ly.complaint is that it makes a high pitch whining noise when plugged in. It is quite irritating. I'm contacting the vendor to see if they can send a replacement as maybe this one is unusual.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M. Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Fancy, but just a toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is good for 4 slices of bread at the same time. It manages larger slices of bread like sourdough or pumpernickel. It has features for 1-sided toasting for bagels, and a defrost option for frozen items like waffles. It has a digital counter to show you progress towards your desired setting and has a little chime when its done. I haven't figured out all my preferred settings yet so its quite capable of burning things. For this price you kind of expect it to be smarter, but its just a machine following orders. There are devices with smaller counter-space footprints that do the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew AZ

customer_reviews.title: So far it is good
customer_reviews.text: It has only been a month or so, but it has been great to have a toaster that actually works. We went through 2 toasters in a year and it was fairly obvious when we first brought them home that they would not last long. This has a durable feel to it and it does a great job of toasting. The last toaster we had would barely brown the toast on max setting. This one will start burning toast on 5 out of 7. It does great on gluten free bread but you have to put it on 7 to start getting it toasty.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: It’s the Cadillac of toasters!  I read the whole manual!
customer_reviews.text: I do think that they put the electrical plate on the bottom of the toaster on in the wrong direction! However, I have not found anything else wrong with this toaster. SO FAR SO GOOD. We toast a lot. I went out and bought bagels, bread, English muffins and frozen waffles because I purposely wanted to see if this toaster is all it’s cracked up to be since it was SO EXPENSIVE! I like the toaster. However, IT IS OVERPRICED.
customer_reviews.author: mrs book worm to you

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than a year and it frightens my 85 pound dog
customer_reviews.text: If you leave this plugged in, it make a high-pitch noise that drives my dog crazy, so you have to unplug it. After less than a year, one side stopped working. I guess I'm crazy asking for a $70 toaster to last more than 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Cooking with Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Our 10 year old Oster toaster had gotten to be a hit & miss as to toasting anywhere from brown to black. This Cuisinart is perfect. I have a 3 year old 4-slice Cuisinart at our main home that I liked, but I think I like the 2 slice even better (takes up less room & actually seems to work faster/better). Happy with purchase. (But then I have numerous Cuisinart appliances and they have all been outstanding.)
customer_reviews.author: Justa Girl

customer_reviews.title: Burnt on one side white on the other.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this toaster for the nice features. Sadly it makes toast burnt on one side and white on the other. I even tried a second toaster with the same results. Had to return it for a refund and now have to find another toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and get it. Mine works great!
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and works just like it's supposed to. I was worried because of the negative reviews, but I've got the 4 slice and love it so thought I'd risk it. I moved in to a tiny house and needed something smaller because I eat LOTS of toast. I mean like daily. It's only been about a month and I didn't recycle the package just in case I need to return it but so far so good. 4 stars because I'd like to get just a little bigger piece of bread in there. Oh and the bagel thing works... Only toasts the top. I didn't realize that's what the bagel setting did and I had that on my other one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: When I got my Celiac diagnosis, I had to replace my toaster and I selected this one. It's not the cheapest one, but I decided that it was worth a small splurge. I'm glad that I found this one. I like the way that it looks quite a lot, and its features are great. The 'bagel' setting really works well and makes a big difference in the outcome of things such as bagels and sandwich rolls, keeping most of it soft while only toasting one surface of the bagel or roll. I actually find myself using this feature a lot.
customer_reviews.author: skye astara

customer_reviews.title: Color control
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet used this product. When I received it, I plugged it in to test it. I found that I could not change the toast setting color from #4, either up or down, on either side. This toaster was to replace another Cuisinart that was working perfectly for the past five years until one of the heating element burned out out after five years of daily use. I am returning it, and will update this review depending on the performance of the replacement. Joe
customer_reviews.author: joeplt8888

customer_reviews.title: Makes a constant hum noise dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this toaster. After using, while still plugged in, it has a constant low electrical hum. The only way to make it stop is unplugging it. We thought we had a lemon, so we returned the first one and got a replacement. It did the same thing. We returned it as well and opted for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Matt and Desi

customer_reviews.title: Fake 1 star reviews posted, great toaster
customer_reviews.text: Read all the 1 star reviews on many toasters and noticed the same (copy paste) neg reviews appearing on several toasters. Clearly fake neg reviews. That said I picked this toaster as my third and hopfully final toaster. It cost a lot more than the others but I wanted a toaster that stayed down every time I pushed the handle down. This one does. You can tell it has a different internal design to catch it. You can feel it when its pushed down. This design is also slightly wider at the bottom which makes it more stable when pushing it down. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster and features
customer_reviews.text: We had the previous version of the Cusinart toaster and I like this one better. There have been some reviews that have had a high pitched noise when plugged in but we have not heard anything, very silent and easy to set.
customer_reviews.author: Duckwood

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this toaster in March of 2019. I returned it and received a replacement because it was making a high-pitched, electronic sound. The new one still made this sound, but it wasn’t so loud. Less than a year later, the filaments on the inner sides of the slots aren’t heating and we can’t toast anything evenly. I had higher expectations since it’s Cuisinart brand.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie G.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice toaster with darkness settings.
customer_reviews.text: Settings are easy to understand and use. Has a bagel setting as well as toast. I didn't have any problem getting toast and bagels to the right darkness, which is important to me. We have had this toaster for over a year now and no malfunctioning. It is used almost daily, the slots are plenty big for puffy bagels. Glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Makes high pitched ringing sound when plugged in
customer_reviews.text: I do not usually write reviews but wanted to let fellow consumers know, this toaster makes a high pitched ring at all times when it is plugged in. Amazon sent me a replacement toaster in the event this was manufacturer defect. The replacement did the same thing (although it was a little quieter). Ring completely goes away when toaster is unplugged. Would not recommend. Also our favorite sourdough toast from local bakery did not fit in toast slots. Love the look and simplicity- but not functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CPT-415: Good toaster, Horrible electronics
customer_reviews.text: The build quality of the toaster is pretty good, however the constant tone that it makes while plugged in is just unnacceptable. I plan on returning this toaster ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Roman Bogushevich

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: Although we had a delivery issue and this was definitely an open box I am not deducting a star for Amazon mistakes. This toaster is absolutely the best I ever had. Works as promised makes great toast. Love the countdown and beeps when the toast is done. Even did my bagel great. Great looking also. As long as it lasts we’re very happy
customer_reviews.author: Bobav

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: This toaster looks nice. I’ll give it that and only that. When plugged in it makes a terrible noise. We returned the original one and exchanged it. The second one had the same issue, super loud. Makes a hissing sound. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Uneven toasting and darkest toast setting (7) is still too light
customer_reviews.text: Not all of the coils heat up and consequently bread is often toasted unevenly, sometimes not at all in certain areas. Also, the highest setting (7) does not do the trick: toast is still too light and I end up re-toasting. Looks good, and the blue lights are cool, but very disappointed in this product. Feel like I wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: NM

customer_reviews.title: Respectable Toaster with Flawed Frills
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good, consistent toast. Bagel setting works well. Performs as expected. Cons: We get a LOUD, piercing high-pitched whine from the LCD display. It might be related to the blue backlight, because when the LCD goes to sleep the whine is reduced to background noise. I would have given 5 stars if they had left out the LCD. It's pointless and causes problems.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Defective product - DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I saw previous reviews about this toaster making a high pitch hissing/buzzing noise but decided to give it a try anyways. Those reviews are accurate, as ours made the same noise nonstop when plugged in. I returned the product and the replacement I received also made the hissing noise. I recommend looking at other products since this is clearly defective.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Walker

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart 4 slice toaster
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster. Glad it has two settings as my hubby and I use different types of bread--he eats that kiddie white bread (thank God I can buy it with wheat in it). I like the heartier multigrain breads that necessitate a higher setting to toast the bread. I do on occasion like to toss a waffle in it as well so the defrost setting works well also. I also like the reheat setting so when we make our burgers and the toast is done before hand, we can reheat the bread without re-toasting it. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Toaster that TOASTS!
customer_reviews.text: I went out on a limb to buy this, due to having a couple different toasters in the past that never really did what they were intended to. This toaster toasts bread VERY well, waffles not as good as I'd like (personal preference), but the digital readout and countdown timer is a nice feature. One little minor issue is with the "buzzing" sound that comes from it when plugged in. It's faint and I can only assume it's because of the transformer inside, but it isn't a deal breaker...I just unplug it when it isn't being used.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Morvay

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Was presently surprised how even this item toasts. It's not absolutely perfect however it also does not cost $199.00. The defrost mode works great for frozen waffles etc. and the Bagel function works very well...(Remember to put the cut sides facing each other. Beats having a $15 toaster that does not come close to getting the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly Brown's keto bread
customer_reviews.text: I used this for the first time today with some keto bread which is notoriously hard to brown. On the 4 setting it evenly toasted my bread on both sides, very much an improvement over my Krups two slice toaster. It does have a bigger footprint, not quite double the size of a two slice one, but finding the counter space was worth it. There don't seem to be any long and narrow ones anymore. Very happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Crjsahm

customer_reviews.title: Diagonal toasting
customer_reviews.text: Although I like the basic features of the Cuisinart CPT-435 toaster, the first toaster I had delivered, burned the upper quadrant of the bread while the lower quadrant wasn't toasted at all. I immediately called Cuisinart Customer Relations and they did not have a answer to this problem and suggested I contact Amazon for a return. I did that and received a new toaster the next day. The new toaster is working as advertised, but I am disappointed about having to go through the return. Will see how it goes in the coming weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Hutwelker

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage...
customer_reviews.text: The first one we received was defective. The left side was poorly assembled and wouldn't even move up or down. We sent it back and the second one we received emits a low hum at all times...even when not toasting anything. You can hear it all day long. I've fiddled with it to no avail. This brand is junk and so are the toasters. I am returning for a full refund and never buying from Cuisinart again. If you're looking to purchase a new high end toaster, I'd keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: T. Place

customer_reviews.title: Makes a hissing noise
customer_reviews.text: The device works really well. I love everything about it, but it makes a noticeable “hissing” noise at all times while plugged in. I’m not sure if this is a danger or not, but it’s definitely annoying. I tried to call Cuisinart customer service but the wait time was really long, so I’ll likely submit an email. For a $60 toaster, I was hoping to just make waffles without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Less than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Cons - Uneven toast, Ugly busy front, Countdown timer is useless, Large black branding on front. Pros- looks well made. Made in China as is every toaster I could find under $150. I couldn't find a reasonably priced toaster from Mexico, India or any ware except China. A toaster should be able to toast bread on both sides in a fairly even pattern. This one could not.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: I love the settings, the countdown bars are very helpful and the reheat feature is fantastic! I hate racing to butter toast, English muffins, bagels, etc. but this toaster is great to pull out one piece and put the other back down on reheat and keep it warm until I’m ready for it.
customer_reviews.author: DHL

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've had this for a few months now and so far it's worked perfectly. My old lady thinks the count down feature is stupid but I've come to rely on it - keeps me occupied while waiting, I guess. Anyhow, it looks pretty good and the warm up actually works. (although how in the hell you warm up cold toast without burning it is beyond me) I noticed some reviewers mentioned noises but mine is as quiet as a mouse - luck of the draw maybe?

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster to replace a $15 Oster toaster I had for years. I thought Cuisinart was a good brand, as I have several other appliances from them. This toaster is a complete disappointment. It does not toast evenly, leaving the edges burned and the middle cold. It does not look like all of the heating elements work. I am going to return it and get something that works.
customer_reviews.author: Film Music Fan

customer_reviews.title: East to Clean
customer_reviews.text: I had a toaster for a few years, and I didn't clean it as I should've, and eventually, it got so dirty I had to dispose of it. Partially my fault, but what I like about this one is how easy it is to clean. Just be sure to do it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Jordon

customer_reviews.title: Isn't that what toasting bread is all about?  Texture and flavor?
customer_reviews.text: Toasts very well and very quickly. Just the very slightest difference in shade on each side of my toast, but not enough to worry or gripe about. (If you want perfect, use a toaster oven, put the rack in the middle position, and wait a while!) I like setting 4 on this toaster because it makes the texture and flavor of my multi grain bread pop! Isn't that what toasting bread is all about? Texture and flavor? The Cuisinart CPT-435 does it for my family!
customer_reviews.author: Robert in TexasTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing
customer_reviews.text: Can’t even review the functionality of the toaster... plugged the toaster in and immediately boxed back up. Made a very high pitched buzzing, couldn’t handle?
customer_reviews.author: Laura Smith

customer_reviews.title: makes a whirling noise all the time!
customer_reviews.text: We had our first toaster for 17 years -- I thought I bought the same model, but this newer version is awful. I'm considering returning. When plugged in it makes this soft (but noticeable) whirling noise. Its very annoying to have in the kitchen. One side of the toaster is always so much darker than the other side, terrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: ghwood

customer_reviews.title: Faint hissing noise
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster! My only reason for not giving it 5/5 stars is the fact that when the LEDs aren’t lit, it makes this faint hissing noise. I have to unplug it after using it just to make it stop. I can also hit cancel on both sides which makes the LED screens light up and the hissing stop but as soon as they go off it does it again. I looked it up and it seems like I’m not the only one with this problem but even though some exchanged those toasters, the hissing was still there with the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Hale

customer_reviews.title: Best Toaster I've ever owned...
customer_reviews.text: Not enough good things can be said about this toaster...the timing feature is best - as for the first time in my life I am not guessing as to when the toast will be...toasted...the longer slots...the bagel feature that toasts one side (which also comes in handy for bruschetta) ...outside does not get too hot...it's very friendly and utile... Cleaning got 1 star because there is no such thing as an *easy* to clean toaster...this unit adheres to that rule...
customer_reviews.author: war

customer_reviews.title: Uneven Toasting
customer_reviews.text: I received the toaster and it didn't work straight out of the box. One side of the toast was done and one side didn't even look slightly toasted.
customer_reviews.author: Keith D Colton

customer_reviews.title: Handle is very stiff
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to put lever down. Doesn't seem to want to engage at bottom. Supposed to be a high-lift lever, but it doesn't do that, either. As others have said, the BEEP when finished is very annoying. We have a Cuisinart coffeemaker that lets you mute the sound, but the toaster does not.
customer_reviews.author: Mike West

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Just what i needed. I did not want to leave a toaster out on my counter all the time. This one is nice enough looking one could however but it is light weight and no trouble at all to put out when needed. The toasting options are great.
customer_reviews.author: Expert Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Love this new toaster. We now have lots of bagels that are toasted perfectly. This even has a setting for you to put a frozen bagel in and it toasts just right. I love the reheat feature also. Looks very nice sitting on the counter top. Very pleased with this toaster. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda g

customer_reviews.title: A very good toaster.
customer_reviews.text: Toasts well and even on both sides. Does the job. Looks good. Gets hot on the sides but not nearly as bad as a Krups that I returned. No humming noise that some people complain about. Recommend it. Would be better if had settings between the numbers, such as 4.5 or 3.5. Also, the alarm that sounds when the toast is done is way too loud, and that comes from someone who is hard of hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Les Gapay

customer_reviews.title: Loud beep cannot be disabled. Not really "Countdown"
customer_reviews.text: The "countdown" timer is just a bar graph dissapearing. It's not an actual countdown timer showing minutes and seconds remaining. Also, when your toast is done there is a loud beep that cannot be turned off or disabled. It woke our kids at 6AM. This was unnacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Count down "timer" is a bar that gets smaller as ...
customer_reviews.text: Count down "timer" is a bar that gets smaller as time goes down. When i think timer I think actual digital timer. When this appliance is plugged in it makes a low buzzing sound at all times. It got two stars instead of one because it does actually toast bread, just don't expect anything more.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: Toasty!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit in red. Goes perfect with the Keurig sitting next to it. It toasts great for us on 4. I gave it 4 stars due to the lever is pretty hard to press down but not bad enough to return it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Annoying BEEP sound
customer_reviews.text: Toasts quickly and looks fine on our counter. HOWEVER, beware of annoying BEEP BEEP sound when toast is done. Fairly loud too. Probably would not have purchased had I realized. Trying to figure out how to disable or muffle the beeps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Hisses like there's a gas leak
customer_reviews.text: As several have stated here but I missed when I did my research, because of the lighted display, this device hisses even when it is sitting dormant without the lights on. It sounds just like a gas-leak so I'm very surprised this device made it to the market, either some don't make the noise or people have loud houses!
customer_reviews.author: Ksherms

customer_reviews.title: Great results, does have a high pitched sound until unplugged
customer_reviews.text: I love the results. Was especially impressed when using a frozen english muffin and how it has the defrost button! They turn out crisp and hot! The only thing I don't like is the high pitched sound it makes after it's done and pops up until you unplug it. Not loud, but loud enough that we all go "ughhh!" and quickly unplug it.
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: Second time purchased, we are very pleased with this model!
customer_reviews.text: We had the same model but it got dented in moving to our new home so Ivwas pleased to see I could replace it with the same model. I know this is a great toaster, 100% proven many times over.
customer_reviews.author: David O. Schoennagel

customer_reviews.title: Great, but.
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful toaster for a great price. However. There is a faint but constant electronic whine coming from it when it's plugged in. Even when it's not being used.
customer_reviews.author: Mousetrap

customer_reviews.title: Totally toasted toaster.
customer_reviews.text: Junk toaster,not worthy of the Cuisinart name. Digital "control" system failed during second use. Now I have to bang on it and slap the handle down hard to get it to work,only to have it quit mid toast. Designer should be fired.
customer_reviews.author: the corpse

customer_reviews.title: Not as Good as I Had Expected from Cuisinart
customer_reviews.text: It's attractive, as toasters go, and the count-down number system is nice, as are the buttons, but it toasts both bagels (the ones that fit) and English muffins very unevenly and, also, quite slowly. A thick, real New York bagel will not fit into the toaster at all. The prior toaster we had, which looked much the same but bore a different brand name, did a better job (until it broke).
customer_reviews.author: Larchmont Resident

customer_reviews.title: Good, but a bit uneven
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice toaster but can toast a bit unevenly. I really like the bagel and defrost options. My biggest complaint is that there is no way to stop it (as far as I know) from beeping when the toasting cycle is done. This is a bit of a pain because it's loud and wakes up my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Murr

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistant Toasting & Browning
customer_reviews.text: Very unsatisfied with this 4-slice toaster. The default setting of #4 produces warmed bread with little color. When set at #5 on side of bread is OK the other is partially burnt. Big sigh. Honestly, how difficult is it to manufacture a simple toaster you can depend on to make consistently acceptable toasted bread. Don't recommend this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Severson

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster with an annoying squeal
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster - it's fast, powerful, and toasts evenly regardless of thin bread or thick bagels. But beware - anyone with decent hearing (above 12kHz) - this thing puts out an ominous howling sound that drives dogs and bats (and me) crazy the entire time it is plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Mopar Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster
customer_reviews.text: I have the 4 slice and when my mother asked for a new toaster for Christmas I bought her what I knew. This is a great toaster - she loves it. Out 4 slice version is great - we've had it for years and it still works great and gets used EVERY day. If your family likes to toast like mine does spend the money and buy quality.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Hissing noise from LCD panel on left.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t owned this toaster for long, 2weeks, but will update the toasting utility later. -However the appliance🔌does make an odd hissing sound. If I press any of the push buttons on the left panel the sound will stop 🛑, but only momentarily.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse James

customer_reviews.title: Beeps
customer_reviews.text: Would not have purchased it if I realized it emits a loud, high pitched, double beep when it's done. I eat breakfast when others are sleeping! Big design flaw
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for toaster
customer_reviews.text: Good choice for toaster. One of the better I have ever had. Occasionally does not work with odd sized items or 1 bread piece at a time. But overall verg good.
customer_reviews.author: Private Investor

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is dangerous
customer_reviews.text: The return window closed on March 11th or this would have definitely gone back. The toaster toasts one side of a waffle or piece of bread and doesn't toast the other side at all, like one side of a frozen waffle is still cold. This morning the toaster began emitting a burning smell that only grew stronger after it was unplugged. This toaster was a total waste of $65. I should have purchased from a store; then I'd still be within the return window. Now I'll have to buy another toaster because this one is just not safe. Please be careful and be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Chrysti

customer_reviews.title: Why can't toasters toast evenly any more? This model ...
customer_reviews.text: Why can't toasters toast evenly any more? This model is very appealing but the 4 setting doesn't do the job and 5 is some times too much. I can't believe how when I was young we took toasters to granted. Now getting an evenly toasted anything is an art.
customer_reviews.author: Gmando61

customer_reviews.title: Excellent versatile toaster
customer_reviews.text: Toaster works quite well. I wish the spring was a bit stronger. It has a hard time lifting thick bagels up all the way, but when the toasting cycle is over, it is over, even if the bagel isn't up all the way. The display is very nice and shows the progression of the toasting cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B

customer_reviews.title: Worked less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first few times we used it. Now it only toasts on one side. And yes, I'm sure it's not on bagel.
customer_reviews.author: S Hawes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: We had an older modal Cuisinart for years, and it still works great. Wife said she did not need a new one, but I got this one anyway because it"s an upgrade to be updated, and now She really likes this one a lot better now than the older one.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: I just want evenly toasted bread.
customer_reviews.text: Makes a humming noise when not in use. It had good reviews on consumer reports so I purchased to replace a toaster that did not toast evenly. This one turns out to be worse than my old one. We have the acess to the collective human psyche in our pockets....but we can evenly toast bread? It has an annoying beep when the toast "done". Is the sounds of toast popping up enough of a notification? Also this unit has a strange smell for the first 10 to 20 cycles. Overall not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this toaster.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice toaster that can handle 1-4 slices of thin up to bagels. Easy to set and seeming toasts uniformly, as usual top a little more done, but guess what, heat rises. The setting lights are bright but dim when not in use, very attractive on counter, makes us look affluent when we are not! Friends that came over for dinner just ordered one as they saw ours.
customer_reviews.author: DC-Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Weird Hissing Noise when not in use
customer_reviews.text: I have one of these currently that I purchased 2 years ago that works great. Wanted to order a second one and not only did it almost burn the toast on the lowest setting but it also makes a hissing noise when not in use. Sent for a replacement and the replacement did the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dan C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice toaster
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is a great compromise between and cheap Walmart toaster and a $300.00 high-end model. Looks great on my counter and toasts very well. The crumb tray works very well. Wipes down easy with damp cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster worked o.k. for a year and, suddenly, would only toast one side at a time while the other side became wt and soggy. Horrible waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Iva Biggun

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but just average results
customer_reviews.text: Looks nicer than it works Very loud obnoxious beep when finished toasting. The settings are inconsistent. Sometimes level 3 toasts perfectly how I like it then the next day level 3 will barely toast!
customer_reviews.author: BETSY DELLORUSSO

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT !
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing! Cuisinart is supposed to be a high-end brand, but this toaster is nothing but a very low-end product. The very first toasts I made came out almost white on one side and overdone on the other. For a toaster, need I say more? I wouldn't but I will: the product is very light, indicating second quality material, and the knobs make a "cheap product sound" when pulled down. In summary, it is going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Merrimack

customer_reviews.title: Great toast, but broke after two months, warranty not great
customer_reviews.text: Toaster was great, but one day about two months after purchase I plugged it in and it just wouldn't turn on. Somehow it had bricked itself. Looked into warranty: if you live on the East Coast, shipping to the Glendale, AZ service center is about $20 + packaging. They also want $7 "to facilitate the speed and accuracy of your return." At that price, you can get a new toaster for $10 more here on Amazon. Seems they have some quality-control issues (others here have had similar experiences where the toaster stops working after only a few months).
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for even 6 months
customer_reviews.text: We don't use the toaster very often -- only a few times a week. The first problem with this toaster was that it could not handle even a slightly larger piece of bread. We had to cut it in half, which meant double the time if you want 2 pieces of toast. Then the toaster started burning bread in October, which was less than 6 months after we bought it. Cuisinart refuses to respond when we contacted them.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good toaster
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing that I can say that is a negative. I like the toaster and would maybe give it a 5 star but I have not used it long enough to be able to say it has a good long longevity. And have mainly used it for bagels - so can't really say too much about its versatility yet. But I like it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice toaster easy to use sleek design no issues
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version for five years it worked fine had this one for one month so far so good easy to use only wish was wider slats for the fat New Jersey bagels I get boy do I miss my old Brooklyn bagels
customer_reviews.author: Raymond A. Rasa

customer_reviews.title: A very nice toaster!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm extremely satisfied with my toaster. It's really sharp looking. I wanted something that wouldn't take up too much counter space, and this toaster is very compact. All the different functions work perfectly. The toasting is completely even on both sides. I'm not crazy about the loud beep and I wish it had a volume knob to turn it down, but maybe I'll get used to it. If nothing else, if you're still half asleep in the morning while toasting your waffles, it will wake you right up! :)
customer_reviews.author: Maria C. Cruz

customer_reviews.title: First we loved this toaster
customer_reviews.text: First we loved this toaster, that we got May 25th , today is June 30th and it got broke . Just stopped working instantly . So , I am not sure we this one is bad or they all like this .
customer_reviews.author: Iren

customer_reviews.title: Poor Warranty Service.
customer_reviews.text: Was a great toaster while it lasted, but sadly died after 9 months. The lever would not stay down to toast the bread. Cuisinart Warranty is 3 years, but when I contacted them, Its company policy to charge you $10 for shipping a replacement product to you and then you are responsible for return shipping on the broken product too. Which for me is over 50% of my new products original price. A very poor company policy for a product which lasted 9 months under light use for the two of us here. I will go with another brand now...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and still toasting
customer_reviews.text: We bought this toaster 4 years ago and its still working well. We love the reheat function. Only complaint is that crumbs get all over the counter, but from reading reviews of other toasters, this seems like a universal problem.
customer_reviews.author: TNT

customer_reviews.title: Annoying beeping impossible to avoid.
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit cheap in the finish. Plus it has that really annoying beeping when the toast is done. Like, I can hear the thing pop up and I don't want to wake up everyone else in the house. The Breville also beeps annoyingly, but at least if you hit cancel just before it's done you won't wake the dead. Cuisinart is determined to do just that. Grrr. Makes toast pretty well though.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Michael C. Neale

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother buying this
customer_reviews.text: We looked at reviews for this toaster before purchasing it. What a disappointment! In order to get any toast color you must set it on at 6 and then lost the bread twice. So sorry we purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Robinson

customer_reviews.title: A toaster that doesn't toast?
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the price. This doesn't toast evenly, burnt one side and "warmed" the other. The outside of the unit gets really hot. This toaster is getting sent back. It has one job to do....toast bread!
customer_reviews.author: S.m

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CPT-415 Countdown 2-Slice Stainless Steel Toaster
product_meta.description: Size:2-SliceThe stylish stainless 2-Slice Countdown Metal Toaster by Cuisinart takes toasting to a whole new level. Separate controls defrost waffles before toasting, reheat toast without more browning and reduce heat on uncut side of bagels. Seven browning settings and self-adjusting slots mean thick and thin slices are toasted as desired. LCD countdown toasting-time bar display makes it easy to keep track. Perfect toast, English muffins, bagels and more.
feature_bullets: Stainless steel housing and blue backlit LCD countdown feature display. Cord length : 36 Inches

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,956 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
